oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Invoice of stores delivered by Lieutenant S. H. Stevens, Chicago Board of Trade Battery Illinois Volunteers to William Alonzo Wainwright
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wainwright, William Alonzo, 1832-1904; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps; Stevens, Sylvanus Harlow, 1827-1902; United States -- Army -- Illinois Artillery -- Chicago Board of Trade Battery (1862-1865); Mercury (Steamer)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page printed form noting packages and contents, such as coils of rope, cases of saws, barrels of linseed oil, et cetera. Invoice of stores delivered by S. H. Stevens to W. A. Wainwright, via Steamer Mercury, from Smithland, Kentucky, to Nashville, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-70
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During the Civil War, the Quartermaster's Department under the leadership of Montgomery C. Meigs provided supplies for the half-million men in the Union Army, ran the Army's first major depot system, and transported unprecedented levels of supplies and personnel. In 1862 the Quartermaster Department also assumed responsibility for burial of war dead and care of national cemeteries.
